text: <!channel>: We can always talk here, might be faster? :grinning:
at this point - you may be correct
hmmmm: Lytro Illum @Amazon: Usually ships within 1 to 2 months.
May need an alternate supplier

text: Might be the unfortunate reality
Lytro's site: Order now for October delivery
hmmm - I suppose it depends on when in October - but yeah, assuming it's not 10.01, we might need to go the ebay route
I'm examining some online stores, but nothing concrete
There's some auctions that are less. But in terms of buying now and not bidding, this one is it.
okay
Navdy: <https://www.navdy.com/>

attachments.title: Navdy feels like driving in the future
attachments.text: Navdy's magical head up display projects information as if it's floating six feet in front of you. Manage your navigation, calls and apps with voice and simple hand gestures. In the car you already have.
attachments.fallback: Navdy: Navdy feels like driving in the future

text: Shipping early 2015
<@U0260V4K1>: Did we want to look into any of the phones with built in apps (Nokia, etc?)
hmmmmmm
And gesture cams - any specific ones you like?
in terms of phones with built in apps - lets hold off on those
those will be easy to come by if we find we need them
as for gesture cams, I don't know enough to have an opinion
Fire phone and goPro has us in the $4000 range now, plus around 1600-2000 for another Lytro.
SO we're at 6000 worst case
okay cool
I think that's probably fine, but let's just double check with marce before we pull the trigger
Is there more value to a second Lytro than a gopro array?
I'm fine with that range generally.
Also realized that it might be easier for me to buy using my Amazon account if you don't have prime.
I think if we have to choose - I'd go with a second lytro
I don't, haha, since my student ran out and I haven't had much to spend on Amazon in the short term.
All good. Let's go for the 6k. That's a little less than half the budget.
ideally we have both, but if it's one or the other, I think the lytro will yield more insight into "regular" person usage
So two Lytros.
Now to find another Lytro...
And the go pro array and fire phone
Yep, that's where we are at right now
perfect
don't sweat it too much on the second lytro right now
lets just set up an alert and watch things for a couple days
Will do
I'm sure we can nab one
I know we're going to over pay a little, but we're not so time critical as to have to buy any ol' one right now
Cool. So I will order the first 'buy it now Lytro', and send over a cart (i think that's a thing) to you <@U026NB2U2> with all the Amazon stuff, so you can just log in and checkout in short order.
Sounds good?
Perfect
<@U0260V4K1>: Do you want the Lytro here by Thursday guaranteed, or at Monday at the latest? 100$ difference in shipping
USPS v FedEx
I'll leave that to marce
Im probably okay with Monday, but if we have the money on hand, sooner is always better
Truth. Just didn't want to have it come late compared to when you're testing schedule falls
it would be nice to have them early as it would give me a little time with the devices and to set up a test protocol
ummm - if Im making the call - get it here thursday
I can use it over the weekend and get a sense of what we'll need to test
Ok, Thursday it is.
<@U026NB2U2>: Because nothing can be simple, Paypal for ebay doesn't seem to support AmEx
All gear ordered!
boom!
thanks for putting that all together
np. Can't wait to get this stuff in
me too
AR helmet? <http://www.laggano.com/2014/09/daqris-augmented-reality-hard-hat-is.html>
whoa
there are a few snowboarding goggles that have heads up displays. I'm not sure if any of them have cameras built into them
<http://appleinsider.com/articles/14/02/15/using-the-oakley-airwave-15-heads-up-display-with-apples-iphone>

attachments.title: Using the Oakley Airwave 1.5 heads-up display with Apple's iPhone
attachments.text: While Google Glass positions itself as an all-purpose heads-up display, the Recon Instruments Snow2 is a more targeted, mountain-specific sports accessory meant to provide users with data and feedback on the go. AppleInsider recently had the chance to test out the Snow2 integrated with Oakley's Airwave 1.5 goggles when paired with Apple's iPhone.
attachments.fallback: Using the Oakley Airwave 1.5 heads-up display with Apple's iPhone

text: smith, oakley and recon make them
<http://www.reconinstruments.com/products/snow2/>

attachments.title: Snow2
attachments.text: Find out all you need to know about Snow2, the World's most advanced Heads-up Display (HUD) technology for the ski slopes.

text: this integrates with a third party camera and has app support
Oh god I want that
